definition: the name remains, but the reality is gone (idiom)
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive
real/true/honest/really/solid/fruit/seed/definitely
old variant of 亡[wang2]
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased

sentences.english: Friends that desert us in the hour of need are friends in name, chaussures louboutin, not in reality.
sentences.chinese: 在坚苦时辰背弃我们的是名存实亡的同伙。

definition: lit. has a name but no reality (idiom); exists only in name/nominal
the appearance of unity, but divided at heart (idiom); seeming harmony belies underlying disagreement
to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up/falling to pieces
to collapse/to fall apart
imminent danger (idiom); approaching a crisis
to do things each in one's own way
rivers pour away by the day (idiom); going from bad to worse/deteriorating day by day
to squeeze in/to step in/to take part/to step between (two persons in a relationship)
to betray/to desert/to defect from/to turn renegade
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
to exist in name only/empty shell/useless (idiom)
one who is cut off from others (idiom)/one who has chosen to follow a solitary path/(can also be an indirect way of referring to an unmarried person)
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
to check and balance (power)/checks and balances
(of a nation, government etc) demoralized/disunited
